meanings.definition: Assess the suitability or eligibility of someone or something in advance.
meanings.sent1: Before making a decision, they prequalify all applicants.
meanings.sent2: The bank will prequalify you for a loan based on your income.
meanings.sent3: The job interview was so easy, it felt like a prequalify quiz!
meanings.sent4: She wanted to prequalify the potential risks before starting the project.
meanings.sent5: To prequalify for the competition, you must pass the initial test.
